text.*:
Dublin 2019, the 77th World Science Fiction Convention
Status Upcoming
Genre Science fiction
Venue Convention Centre Dublin
Location(s) Dublin
Country Ireland
Inaugurated 15–19 August 2019
Website https://dublin2019.com/

The 77th World Science Fiction Convention (Worldcon), also known as Dublin 2019 — An Irish Worldcon, will be held in Dublin, Ireland from August 15 to 19, 2019.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Guests of Honour
  • 2 Site selection
  • 3 Awards
  • 4 References
  • 5 External links

Guests of Honour[edit]

The guests of honor will include academic Jocelyn Bell Burnell, editor Ginjer Buchanan, fans Mary and Bill Burns, author Diane Duane, game designer Steve Jackson, and author Ian MacDonald.[1]

Site selection[edit]

Dublin in 2019 was the only bid for hosting the 77th World Science Fiction Convention.[2][3] The members of the 75th World Science Fiction Convention voted among the bids, and selected it.

Awards[edit]

The Hugo Awards, named after Hugo Gernsback, are presented every year for the best science fiction or fantasy works and achievements of the previous year. The results are based on the ballots submitted by members of the World Science Fiction Society. Other awards, including the John W. Campbell Award for Best New Writer, are also presented at each year's Worldcon.[4]

The awards will be announced at the convention.

References[edit]

  1. ^ a b StJohn Macintosh, Paul (2017-08-12). "Worldcon off to Dublin in 2019". Retrieved 2017-08-17. 
  2. ^ "Worldcon Bids". Worldcon [Official]. World Science Fiction Society. Retrieved 2017-08-17. 
  3. ^ "Site Selection for 2019". Worldcon 75. Retrieved 2017-08-17. 
  4. ^ "Hugo Award FAQ". The Hugo Awards. World Science Fiction Society. Retrieved 2017-08-17.
